**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line:
>
/kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
As mentioned in [Device plugin resource lifecycle improvement](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1rYE_jcUjQUqWb-ZRJpG_FLDxOWp5mjOGKGE59HLYGNk) doc, for certain types of device plugin resources, their devices need to be reconfigured after node reboot. The devices may not be in the ready state until the device plugin re-registers. The current Kubelet device manager implementation always tries to re-use the cached state. In case of pure node reboot, Kubelet device manager would rebuild its cached state from local checkpoint file, which means it could admit a previously started pod that requests a device plugin resource before the corresponding device plugin re-registers. This could cause undesired behavior that containers might be started without the corresponding resource being ready.
